citations.desc: Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors).
citations.narrative:
The refrigerator in the kennel that stores vaccines is not working. Upon opening the refrigerator, it was noted that the
temperature inside was that of room temperature. When the temperature was measured, it was found that the inside of
the refrigerator was 86 Degrees Fahrenheit. Vaccines that were in the refrigerator stated that they must be stored
between 35-46 Degrees Fahrenheit. Vaccines that are not stored appropriately may no longer be effective and may not
properly protect dogs from diseases. Each dealer shall establish and maintain programs of adequate veterinary care that
include the availability of appropriate facilities, personnel, equipment and services. Correct by ensuring the availability of
appropriate equipment that can adequately store vaccines. Correct by 20-AUG-2024.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the Licensee.
n

narrative:
2.40(b)(1) 
   
Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors). 
The refrigerator in the kennel that stores vaccines is not working. Upon opening the refrigerator, it was noted that the 
temperature inside was that of room temperature. When the temperature was measured, it was found that the inside of 
the refrigerator was 86 Degrees Fahrenheit. Vaccines that were in the refrigerator stated that they must be stored 
between 35-46 Degrees Fahrenheit. Vaccines that are not stored appropriately may no longer be effective and may not 
properly protect dogs from diseases. Each dealer shall establish and maintain programs of adequate veterinary care that 
include the availability of appropriate facilities, personnel, equipment and services. Correct by ensuring the availability of 
appropriate equipment that can adequately store vaccines. Correct by 20-AUG-2024. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the Licensee. 
 
 n
